metadata.Title: CVE-2016-9576 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
The blk_rq_map_user_iov function in block/blk-map.c in the Linux kernel before 4.8.14 does not properly restrict the type of iterator, which allows local users to read or write to arbitrary kernel memory locations or cause a denial of service (use-after-free) by leveraging access to a /dev/sg device.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9576` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1002-aws - 4.4.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1023-azure - 4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-62-generic - 4.4.0-62.83~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-62-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-62.83~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-62-lowlatency - 4.4.0-62.83~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-62-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-62.83~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-62-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-62.83~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-62-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-62.83~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-62-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-62.83~14.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-62-generic - 4.4.0-62.83~14.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1023-azure - 4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-62-generic - 4.4.0-62.83~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-62-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-62.83~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-62-lowlatency - 4.4.0-62.83~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-62-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-62.83~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-62-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-62.83~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-62-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-62.83~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-62-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-62.83~14.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-62-generic - 4.4.0-62.83~14.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> requires access to /dev/sg*, which unprivileged users normally do not have access to.
